meanings.definition: Sharp or severe in effect; intense
meanings.sent1: The acutest pain shot through his arm like a lightning bolt.
meanings.sent2: The acutest cold wind made her shiver uncontrollably.
meanings.sent3: The acutest spiciness of the chili made him sweat profusely.
meanings.sent4: Her words had the acutest impact on his fragile emotions.
meanings.sent5: The acutest fear gripped her heart as she walked through the dark alley.

meanings.definition: Having a keen sense of perception or discernment
meanings.sent1: With the acutest eyesight, the hawk spotted its prey from afar.
meanings.sent2: She had the acutest intuition and always knew when something was wrong.
meanings.sent3: His acutest hearing allowed him to eavesdrop on the secret conversation.
meanings.sent4: The acutest detective in town solved the mystery in record time.
meanings.sent5: The acutest sense of smell led the dog to the hidden treat.

meanings.definition: Showing a high degree of intelligence or insight
meanings.sent1: The acutest student in the class aced every test effortlessly.
meanings.sent2: Her acutest observations often led to groundbreaking discoveries.
meanings.sent3: The acutest scientist in the lab accidentally created a new element.
meanings.sent4: His acutest reasoning skills helped him solve complex problems quickly.
meanings.sent5: The acutest mind in the room came up with a brilliant solution to the puzzle.
